Experimental data in controlled conditions, and personal anecdotes, are no=
t the same thing,

ail.com> wrote:

From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...>

Date: Sunday, August 22, 2=
010, 12:21 AM







=C2=A0



  


    
      
      
      =C2=A0If you c=
ompletely ignore what everyone else in the whole wide freaking world gets v=
ia EVP, various photography and ITC methods, and just chance encounters, th=
en yeah, you probably don't have any data, and won't have any data no matte=
r what. 

=C2=A0
F-S


On Sat, Aug 21, 2010 at 3:42 PM, Rick Wegrzyn <rickw=
egrzyn@...> wrote:


=C2=A0 





Hey RJ,I think we need to go to the=
 cemetary and see what you get there....





From: Rj <rasterer@...>=
 

To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sat, August 21, 2010 2:29:36 PM 

Subj=
ect: Re: [EVP-ITC] Scamp,


=C2=A0 





I don't think I have enough data y=
et to make any conclusions, so I plan more experiments.=C2=A0 Since there a=
re different distinct claims about what the box or the recorders can do, I =
try to make different distinct experiments for each.


Some people claim th=
ey can get the box to tell them things that the operator couldn't know, so =
my "whats the object" experiment is one way to examine that.=C2=A0 Some peo=
ple claim the boxes can make predictions, so cataloging predictions and exa=
mining the results can help examine that.=C2=A0 If there are other claims, =
I will try to figure experiments based on those.

s.com

=C2=A0 


=C2=A0I get ou=
r last dogs from time to time, and used to get them via white noise=C2=A0wh=
en I first started this. Last summer some kids came down into the basement =
wiht the younger grandson, and the little yorkie barked, but "get outta her=
e" came out, some how. 

=C2=A0
=C2=A0Yeah, I think I was too hard on RJ. I=
 don't know why, but testing doens't seem to work, but we get enough to pro=
ve this to ourselves. It's probably a faith thing, although I'm not religio=
us, even anti-religion.=C2=A0 

=C2=A0
=C2=A0F-S
=C2=A0
=C2=A0


On Fri, Au=
g 20, 2010 at 6:27 PM, <SnowfireL@...> wrote:

) from SnowfireL@... included below] 

Here is a short file, where some=
one says, "Scamp, Scamp," then Scamp barks. "yap."=C2=A0 This little dog be=
longed to my grandma, when I was about 9 or 10 years old, he was a Manchest=
er Terrier, and lived with us for many years, and this is his bark for sure=
.=C2=A0 I'd know that bark anywhere.=C2=A0 Sorry, that I can't make it any =
clearer, I need to get one of those better ghost boxes I guess.=C2=A0=C2=A0=
RJ, spirits are just like us, they are not omnipresent like God,=C2=A0=C2=
=A0probably why David doesn't want to play the guessing game, he has better=
 things to do over there, and has said, they have thousands of people stand=
ing in this long line waiting to get into the Heavens, and He can't just dr=
op His job and go to your house to see what you have over there, He did tel=
l me that first time what it was, and i sent it to you, but it was too late=
.=C2=A0 It's hard for me to understand them sometimes, He was also right ab=
out that little boy, Syler being killed, and where his body would be
 found=
, I don't know what they did about it though. sf
